name: sensuousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of affecting or relating to the physical senses, rather than pleasing the mind or the intelligence: There is a lovely dense sensuousness to her poetry. His watercolors of flowers, fruit, and vegetables have an almost shocking sensuousness.
the expression or suggestion of physical, especially sexual, pleasure or satisfaction: He secretly led a life of happy sensuousness with his first love. She stalks the stage with teasing sensuousness. See
sensuous
More examplesFewer examplesthe velvet sensuousness of the sound of his celloThe novel is swollen with autumnal sensuousness, like fruit threatening to burst its skin.He moved with the natural sensuousness of a panther.
